page.title: 15Organised Religion, The Lee
page.content: The{Anglican Church}is St. John the Baptist & the Vicar is Alan Paice, who is also responsible for 3 neighbouring parishes. An elected Parochial Church Council & 2 Churchwardens conduct the business. Services each Sunday are Holy Communion, & Morning Prayer or Parish Communion. A thriving young church, led by lay people, meets in the Old Church. The{Methodist Church} in Lee Common has a service at 3pm each Sunday taken by the minister from Chesham or a lay preacher.{Free Church - Emmanuel Hall, Swan Bottom, has a service at 6pm on Sundays taken by the lay people. The members of the congregation organise the services. The{Baptist Chapel}has been converted to a residential building & there is no {Roman Catholic}church in The Lee, so Baptists go to Chesham & Catholics to Great Missenden or Wendover.
